userreviews.userReview: ★★★★1/2! Because You Are Mine series, book 1-8 of 8. Another whirlwind romance with a dominant & controlling, rich & sexy alpha male hero!“Because You Are Mine” (Ian’s & Francesca’s story) is an 8-part series, released in the fall of 2012. Combined they make a 368-page read. Please note that the Omnibus will be released in March 2013. And there will be a sequel to this series, “When I'm With You” (Lucien’s & Elise’s story) to be released in 8 weekly installments starting March 3, 2013 (series complete by April 23, 2013).Since I am a reader in need of a HEA, I made sure I waited to read this series until all installments had been released. I read it in one sitting, thus I will review as a set. Hero: Ian Noble/British/30 years old/mogul-playboy/$$$$/dark hair/blue eyes/domHeroine: Francesca Arno/American/23 years old/student-artist/red-gold hair/brown eyes/innocentFrancesca is a young artist, who entered her painting in a competition held by the billionaire, Ian Noble. She wins the competition and is commissioned to create the centerpiece painting for the lobby of Ian’s new Chicago Skyscraper. The book opens up at the reception held in her honor. Ian and Francesca are introduced and she feels in instant attraction (recognizing he is out of her league) while he is intrigued, but reserved. He knows she is too innocent for the likes of him. Francesca is a bohemian; she is naïve, sweet and kind. She has a strained relationship with her parents, never quite measuring up. She lives with her three male roommates who are very protective of her. Ian, on the other hand, is the rich and extremely successful business mogul; he is enigmatic, worldly, handsome, sexy and oh so dominant and too “corrupted” for her. But there is much more to it, because Ian is full of secrets. For starters: The reception was not their first encounter. Four years prior Francesca had painted “The Cat That Walks By Himself”. As it turns out Ian had been the inspiration for that painting. She had been sad to have to sell it. And Ian had bought and tracked her down…Ian tries to fight his attraction to Francesca, but it’s a losing battle and so their whirlwind romance begins, taking us across the ocean while Ian and Francesca get to know each other and have lot of scorching hot sex. But as Ian’s secrets are revealed, his mysterious past continues to cast shadows over their relationship. Their love is challenged and their future threatened.I thoroughly enjoyed Ian’s & Francesca’s story. And I very much look forward to Lucien’s & Elise’s story in “When I'm With You”.***Hero rating: 5 stars Heroine rating: 4 starsSex scenes rating: 5 starsSex scenes frequency: 4.5 starsStoryline concept rating: 4.5 starsStorytelling skills rating: 5 starsStory ending rating: 4.5 stars******************************Overall rating: 4.5 starsWould I recommend this series: Yes.Would I re-read this series: Maybe later.Would I read future books by this author: Yes.

Αν και ήθελα πολύ να διαβάσω το συγκεκριμένο βιβλίο, ήμουν προκατειλημμένη. Ίσως γτ λίγες μέρες νωρίτερα είχα διαβάσει την τριλογία This Man και είχα απογοητευτεί λίγο. Όντως έχει αρκετά κοινά με άλλα βιβλία αυτού του είδους. Όμως δεν με επηρέασε αρνητικά καθόλου. Η Φραντσέσκα είναι μια ταλαντούχα αλλά άσημη ζωγράφος. Ο Ίαν είναι ένας πετυχημένος επιχειρηματίας, με πολλούς σκελετούς στην ντουλάπα του, που της δίνει την ευκαιρία μέσω ενός διαγωνισμού να γίνει ευρύτερα γνωστή. Μόλις γνωρίζονται της κάνει ξεκάθαρο ότι τη θέλει μόνο δική του. Μέχρι τώρα όλα γνωστά και κοινά με τόσα άλλα βιβλία. Όμως το συγκεκριμένο κατά τη γνώμη μου κάνει τη διαφορά. Ίσως γτ έχει πολλές αναφορές στην τέχνη με αποτέλεσμα να υπάρχει διάχυτος λυρισμός στην ιστορία και τον τρόπο γραφής. Ίσως επειδή εκεί που πάει να γίνει μια σχέση bdsm, στο γυρνάει. Οι πρωταγωνιστές ζουν το κυριαρχικό σεξ όμως προσπαθούν να δουλέψουν τα άλλα κομμάτια της σχέσης, χωρίς ο ήρωας να έχει πάντα δίκιο και να είναι ανελέητος με τις απόψεις του. Παραδέχεται τα λάθη του και δείχνει από την αρχή πόσο ευάλωτος είναι. Όλα αυτά μέσα σε ένα πλαίσιο αναφορών ποίησης, ζωγραφικής και μουσικής. Ίσως δεν μπορώ να προσδιορίσω ακριβώς ποιο ή ποια στοιχεία του βιβλίου το κάνουν διαφορετικό για εμένα, παρά τα κοινά μοτίβα. Κάποιες φορές δεν υπάρχει εξήγηση. Απλά για εμένα αυτό το βιβλίο είναι διαφορετικό και πέρασα υπέροχα διαβάζοντάς το. Η μόνη μου ένσταση στην ελληνική εκδοσή είναι το εξώφυλλο, που θεωρώ ότι δεν έχει καμία σχέση με την ιστορία και ο τίτλος. Έχει μεταφραστεί ως "Είσαι δική μου". Αν κράταγαν το "Επειδή είσαι δική μου" θα ήταν πολύ πιο ξεκάθαρες κάποιες λεπτομέρειες όπως οι μικροί τίτλοι στην αρχή κάθε μέρους, καθώς και τα υπέροχα λόγια που λένε οι ήρωες στο τέλος!!!

This was originally put out as one of those new "serialized series" which i think is what had turned off many people from reading it, myself included. Yes, the cost was kind of steep at $1.99 per installment and there are 8 total so that's a whopping $16 for a book, however, when i used to read and purchase actual books, Shelly Laurenston's Pride series came in Trade size and they ran about $14 per book and i didn't even think twice about purchasing each and everyone of those books when they came out because i loved them! For me, it was having to wait a week for each installment of the story. Having read them ALL in one book i can say for certain that i would NOT have liked reading a story that way!! Some of the chapters ended in the middle of a scene and if i'd had to wait an entire week to get the rest of that scene i would not have been happy! I'm not really sure WHO the publishers were thinking would enjoy this way of reading a book but they must be people like my husband who will open a book every few nights, read ONE chapter then turn off their lamp and go to sleep!! That would def. NOT be me! When i'm reading a book, if i'm really enjoying it, the last thing i want to do is put it down! Having to read a book in that way would have lessened my interest in the story, it would have felt disjointed and i really don't think it would have allowed me to feel fully invested in the couple. Shame on you publishers! This is a cruel and unrealistic way to expect someone to read a book!Ok, RANT OVER.As i said above, i DID read this all as one book and the story as a whole was really quite enjoyable!! Yes, it's the same premise as a lot of books out there right now...the yummy tortured billionaire, who is very controlling and likes his kink in the bedroom, falls for the young innocent woman. Been there, done that...many times...but if the writing is good, the story is well told and i like the characters, i have no problem reading books like this. I like the way Beth Kery writes, she has a really good mix of extremely hot sex and romance with a little bit of emotional angst thrown into the mix. Her characters are smart and real. Ian is obviously a self made billionaire and Francesca is an artist, i loved the little twist of how she "discovered" him the first time without even knowing who he was until much later, The Cat Who Walked Alone. I loved that he saw and accepted her for who and what she was and wasn't trying to make her into the perfect woman for him. Ian could sometimes be cold but not enough to make him unlikeable, he def. had his moments of being sweet and romantic with Francesca and she was not your typical immature whiny heroine that you often find in these books, she was intelligent and had a good head on her shoulders.I just recently found out that the next book, When I'm With You, which is also serialized (unfortunately), will feature another couple (that was introduced in this book) but Ian Noble and Francesca Arno's story will continue on in there as well. Apparently there will also be a third book, which will NOT be serialized (Yay!!) that will complete Ian and Francesca's story. I'm very much looking forward to reading them all and i would not hesitate to recommend this to anyone who enjoys these types of books! :)

We all know that ultimately a novel is a collaboration between author and reader. An author (usually) writes the book that he/she would want to read, and then each reader synthesizes the words, absorbing them through the filter of his or her own experiences, tastes, background and mores, with the end result being a unique reading experience. No two readers will ever experience a story in exactly the same way. Because of that, it always intrigues me to read negative reviews of a book I have loved, or vice versa. This was especially true today, when I read some of the low-rated reviews of Beth Kery's Because You Are Mine, an erotic romance that I just finished and loved. Foremost among the criticisms was that it is in many ways a copy of Fifty Shades of Grey. There are similarities...we have Ian, the dominant alpha billionaire hero with a troubled past and an affinity for BDSM who needs to punish and control Francesca, the beautiful, naturally submissive heroine. Ian, like Christian Grey, professes that he can offer sexual pleasure but not love or romance. Furthermore, a few of the scenes, set-ups and secondary characters in Because You Are Mine are deeply evocative of Fifty. While these similarities made a negative impression on some readers, for me it was just the opposite. (And we can't forget: Fifty itself was the retelling of another tale.) Far from being a hindrance, I loved seeing how Kery would take these similarities and make the story her own, and she did not disappoint. The caliber of her writing, the crafting of her characters and her beautiful language make Because You Are Mine very compelling fiction--erotic writing at its finest. Writing in third person (my preference because it allows an author to tell a broader, richer story), Kery took me on an emotional journey with Ian and Francesca. One of my favorite elements of the novel is the fact that, years prior to their first meeting, Francesca, an artist, had seen Ian from the rear and been moved enough to capture his desolation on canvas:"She’d painted him four years ago. That’s what he was telling her—that he knew she’d observed him walking the dark, lonely streets in the dead of the night while the rest of the world slumbered, warm and content in their beds. Francesca hadn’t realized the identity of her inspiration at the time, nor had he probably known he was being observed until he saw the painting, but there could be no doubt of it. Ian Noble was the cat who walked by himself. And he’d wanted her to know it."That's a beautiful scene, one that speaks to the heart of the connection between these two characters. When it comes to erotic romance, Beth Kery is at the top of her game and the top of my list.There were also a few things about this book that I loved on a personal note, e.g. when Ian takes Francesca to Paris, they stay at the Hotel George V. Apparently, it's the hotel of choice for fictional billionaires. (I have it on good authority that Heaven in the Dark 's David Swift always stays there.) Also, as the book is set largely in Chicago, the protagonists visited many of my favorite spots. Dinner at Trump's hotel? Yes, thanks.In summary, the person that I am--my tastes, my experiences--had a fulfilling journey with these characters. For me, Because You Are Mine was a work of beautiful, nuanced writing, and each turn of the page was time well-spent.

Este é capaz de ter sido um dos livros mais difíceis de 'avaliar' que já me passou pelas mãos. O nosso mercado tem sido inundado de romances sensuais/eróticos, mas penso que uma nova categoria deveria ser criada - a dos livros pornográficos. E com isto não seria exagerado que as editoras começassem a adoptar um sistema de classificação como nos filmes, Maiores de 12, Maiores de 16, Maiores de 18. Mas concentremo-nos na obra em si.Porque És Minha traz-nos a história de Francesca e Ian, que se conhecem numa festa dada em honra de Francesca por ter ganho o financiamento de Ian através de um concurso de pintura em tela. Nem meia centena de páginas depois, estes encontram-se no chão da sala de esgrima prestes a terem relações sexuais. Daí em diante, tudo evolui de forma bastante frenética e explosiva.Ian é um dominador nato cujo prazer sexual passa sempre pela submissão total da sua parceira. É através de um misto de dor e prazer que ele consegue atingir o seu clímax. Quando se começa a envolver com Francesca, uma virgem, depara-se com algumas barreiras e incredulidade por parte dela. No entanto, Francesca não coloca muitos obstáculos e para além de se deixar dominar por completo, aprende a tirar o máximo prazer de tal, mesmo quando a dor poderia parecer insuportável.Ao iniciarmos esta obra, começamos uma viagem por um mundo de luxúria e erotismo. Caracterizada acima de tudo pelas várias fantasias do protagonista, acaba por carecer bastante de um desenvolvimento mais rico e maduro do romance em si. O sexo acontece com bastante facilidade, as crises existenciais de ambos por vezes deixam o leitor exasperado e o fim não poderia ser mais previsível.O ponto forte deste livro acaba por ser toda a descrição das cenas sexuais. Para um romance erótico, que roça o pornográfico, sou da opinião que os cenários estão bem descritos e deixam muito pouco à imaginação. São bastante explícitos e obviamente que se destinam a um público adulto.Beth Kery tem uma escrita fluída utilizando um vocabulário bastante próprio. Nesta sua história concentra-se muito mais nos aspectos sexuais, a roçarem o sadomasoquismo, do que num possível trajecto romântico. Para quem procurar uma boa história de amor com erotismo à mistura, este não é o livro ideal. Porém, se procura uma obra que lhe possa proporcionar cenas picantes, extremamente eróticas enquadradas num contexto BDSM este é um deles.(http://branmorrighan.blogspot.pt/2013...)

When this series was introduced as a serial novel and released a section at a time on Amazon, I anxiously awaited the final installment to be released. I refuse to purchase a small section at a time and have to wait a week before we get the next one. I want all of my story at once. I am bad when it comes to serial novels.I had heard that this series was hot, sexy and worth the Buy Now click on Amazon. Sadly, I can honestly say that I wish I would have forgotten about this book. I had to force myself to even finish reading this book. That is a sad thing when you love to read and you have to force yourself to make it to that final page. I could not bring myself to enjoy the dominant ways of Ian Noble. He could be sweet at times, but overall he was a pushy prick. Yes, I went there. He was cold and nothing about him appealed to my romantic side. When it came to Francesca Arno, she was the naive virgin that had so many conflicts in her character that I was getting whiplash trying to keep up with them. One minute she is the sweet virgin unsure of herself, then the next page she is all of a sudden the sexy temptress teasing the men. I think my eyes rolled more at the stupidity of her actions than it did in boredom.While many people enjoyed this series, I will not be one to read it again or any future stories involving these characters. If I had to force it the first time, I certainly won’t force it again.

We have another rich guy who had a bad childhood and now has to be in control of everything. Ian meets Francesca and has to have her. While Francesca embraced his sexual domination too fast and too willingly I just could not warm up to this guy. He was too closed up and too cold. He also was good at buying his way into her favor after he screwed up.I am not a fan of giving someone the right to punish you for whatever reason. There is too much room to abuse this and Ian is a good example of this. He would "turn her ass red" for whatever imagined infraction he perceived she did. After a while I realized that whenever he would punish her it was because he could no longer deal, he needed it to cope. I would have respected him had he just told her I like to spank you for my pleasure and not make up excuses and putting her in the wrong. Francesca , being a virgin was just too willing to go along with everything. Now it does seem that she enjoyed some of the spankings but the way Ian treated her and the reasons just did not work for me.I did enjoy watching Francesca grow and even stand up to Ian at the end.

This book was ok. I must admit I struggled with the first 50% of the book and felt rather bored with the same monotonous sex scenes. However, the second half altered my opinion. I began to warm to the characters. Despite some of Ian's harsh words, it was apparent he really loved Francesca. I enjoyed Francesca's defiant personality at times, challenging their relationship and encouraging this exceptionally organised and structured man to be spontaneous. Conversely, Watching Francesca grow into her own, in the hands of Ian was heartwarming. Overall, this was a nice Sunday afternoon read when I had some time to spare. I am glad I waited until the book version was released however. I would have felt slightly cheated if I had paid the previous price for the series.

English Version - Full Text:Continuing the current trend of the Portuguese market for erotic books gender, here it comes comes , published by Edições Saída de Emergência [Portuguese Edition], the novel” Because You're Mine”, by Beth Kery. It is an erotic book par excellence, and it cannot be considered soft, rather the contrary. The action takes place between Chicago, Paris and London, and we find as central characters of the plot, as has become somewhat stereotyped in this kind of stories, a sexy, seductive and mysterious billionaire, of British origin - Ian Noble, and an innocent, vivacious , rebellious and curious artist, the young Francesca Arno, who has become acquainted with Noble, because she is the winner of an art competition whose Patron is Ian Noble.Both characters come to reveal a traumatic past [and here also nothing new or unusual in this type of narrative], each in their own way seek to find ways to deal with these traumas. Ian and Francesca are allowed to hold a very strong physical attraction, the strong point of the descriptions of the several meetings between them, by the way it is told us by the author, seem to convey a kind of electrical vibration, an energy that is almost visible and easy to be perceived by the reader.What really pleases and surprises in this story are the constant references to the world of art, the creative process in its various stages and nuances, and Francesca Arno, truly talented and passionate about what she does, portraying emotions in her paintings and capturing what she feels and also what is in her surroundings. And among the protagonists show us a very clear cultural and artistic connection that goes beyond physical and sexual attraction, but certainly also contributes to this aspect, leading to approach two people who, by their age, education, and the lifestyle they lead, are different in everything else except for the passions they have in common. One of the most striking phrases of the book is quoted by the characters, and the title of a painting of Francesca, and ends by describing Ian Noble in its purest essence:"I am the Cat who walks by himself, and all places are alike to me." The novel contains several quite detailed and explicit descriptions of sexual nature, some of them guided by some rawness, as Francesca, a virgin in her twenties, will awaken to sexuality with Ian Noble, who being a control freak in everyday life, just happens to be dominant also in sexual context, taking extreme pleasure of domination practices in this area. If it is true that the book is not smooth in this type of sexual descriptions, and more than half includes explicit sex, sex games, erotic instruments, it should be noted that this reality is well contextualized reality as we watch the emotional and psychological evolution of the two protagonists, and all this it is not shocking when you consider that there is consensus in all the practices described at the novel. One of the parts of the book I liked the most was their trip to Paris, where Ian will start fighting with himself about being completely obsessed with Francesca, fearing already becoming involved beyond the physical component. Francesca, in turn, lives divided between a discovery of a whole sensual world in which she was totally inexperienced, and the fear that she might loose Ian Noble anytime, because of her age and expectations, she soon begins to feel a lot more for her Maecenas than mere physical attraction and sexual yearning. She wants to know more and more about his whole life and help himto fight the ghosts of an unhappy childhood and their impact in his present. Besides Ian and Francesca, we get to know a good range of characters that surrounds them, and these characters end up interacting with each other. The friends with whom Francesca shares the house - especially her confidant Davie - a friendly gallerist! The efficient Lin Soong - Ian´s secretary, his faithful housekeeper - Mrs. Hanson, James, the chauffeur of the Millionaire, Ian´s aristocratic grandparents - the Earls of Stratham, and his best friend - Lucien Lenault (Manager of a Renowned restaurant). Together or not, Francesca and Ian grow up as lovers, can love fight Noble´s heavy past ? And what secret world hides London? Can this secret from Ian Noble be powerful enough to prevent a future with Francesca by his side? An engaging book, well written, openly erotic, but it goes beyond this component, containing cultural references and bringing up some thoughts on the psychological world of characters who could well be real in their respective dramas, faults and virtues!I liked it and recommend it to lovers of the erotic genre._______________________________________________Um livro ousado, com alguns detalhes diferentes e que faz pensar. Gostei e fiquei fã da série, que vou seguir e coleccionar. Vai ter lugar cativo na biblioteca.http://oslivrosnossos.blogspot.pt/201... (leia no blog a review completa)"O que verdadeiramente agrada e surpreende nesta história são as constantes referências ao mundo da arte, ao processo criativo nas suas várias fases e nuances, sendo Francesca Arno uma jovem verdadeiramente talentosa e apaixonada pelo que faz, retratando emoções nas suas pinturas e captando o que sente e também o que a rodeia. E entre os protagonistas surge de modo bem nítido um elo cultural e artístico que vai para além da atracção física e sexual, mas que certamente também contribui para este aspecto, levando a aproximar duas pessoas que, pela idade, pelo contexto em que foram educados, e pelo estilo de vida que levam, são em tudo o resto distintos, excepto nas paixões que têm em comum, de forma inusitada. What to say about this book?? Hot, sexy, emotional, raw, all encompassing. I've read so many erotic novels and it warms my....heart when I find one that is so much more than its genre. I love a flawed character. I love the simple yet complex action of giving over power to someone else. The exchange if power between these two is palpable. Ian knows from the moment he sees himself in Francesca's painting that she knows him better than anyone else. That she has seen him as he is never seen by others. Francesca thinks she has control of her life and that she must maintain this control when is actuality she is out of control if you will and not until he shows her this does she finally get some semblance of control over her life. Because You Are Mine: The Complete Novel is the first Beth Kery novel that I have read. It is the second erotica book that I have ever read, Fifty Shades of Grey being the first. I enjoyed this book more than Fifty Shades of Grey. This book was an extremely sexy read and indulges in erotic fantasies in every chapter. While reading Because You Are Mine: The Complete Novel I saw many similarities with 50 Shades (sexy dominant millionare, emotionally unattached and controlliing who falls for a young innocent female with no sexual experience). I found, however, that Kery did a much better job at adding a quality storyline that flowed better. Ian is a great example of a dominant male. He needs to be the dominant in all aspects of his life, not just in the bedroom. He portrays himself to others as an educated man who is in control of every aspect of his life. Yet there is a piece of him that is vulnerable and a part of his life that he is not in control of. As you read the book and get to know Ian Noble you begin to understand where his vulnerability comes from and why he needs to be in control. He became someone I could relate to on a more personal level and not just a sexual deviant.Francesca - Even though she was inexperienced, she wasn’t a timid female. She has a very stubborn streak that clashes with Ian's stubborness. The chemistry between Ian and Francesca increases through the book. Even though Francesca has no experience with sex, it was interesting how eager she was giving herself over to Ian completely and how trusting she was of him. I thought it made their chemistry that more steamy.Because You Are Mine is a book that you read when you are in the mood for something sexy and erotic. The book is good at what it is and is an enjoyable read. I thought the story was well written with interesting characters that have substance beyond their erotic sexlives. Kery has become one of my go-to authors for erotic romances and I will continue to read this series to see where else Kery takes us with Ian and Francesca's budding romance.

Beth Kery delivers a sizzling hot erotic romance featuring two completely opposite people, innocent virgin Francesca and sexually dominant and BDSM god Ian. She takes the whole sexual world in stride unlike the forever timid Anastasia. I liked the dom/sub relationship much more with Ian and Francesca because it wasn’t explicitly defined and overly discussed with absurd sex contracts like in Fifty Shades of Grey. Because You Are Mine shows two adults having a mutually fulfilling sexual relationship that doesn’t involve at lot of planning and hashing out of details, it just is. And if you were into the whole “red room of pain,” then you will love the sexy room that Ian has at his penthouse {commence drooling}.As this was my first time reading a book by Kery, I was really happy to discover that her writing is spot-on in terms of view points. Throughout the novel, Kery goes in between Francesca’s and Ian’s narration. If we didn’t have Ian’s thoughts, then he wouldn’t have been such a likable character. He comes off as a cold jerk a lot of the time from Francesca’s observations of his body language and tone of voice. Getting a glimpse into his mind from his point of view makes each scene so much more poignant.Even though alpha, dom, billionaires with dark sexual/abusive pasts are the hottest male characters these days in erotic fiction, Ian Noble is a breath of fresh air. Unlike Christian Grey in Fifty Shade of Grey and Gideon Cross from Sylvia Day’s Crossfire series, Ian Noble has not been physically or sexually abused. His darkness comes from having to take care of his mentally ill mother without a support system, thus leading him to want to have complete control over everything. It’s nice to see an author find a new twist on an overplayed theme.From a private jet to the backseat of a luxury car, these two cannot keep their hands off each other. And boy was it fun to watch them find ways to make each other crazy. Because You Are Mine is definitely on my re-read list and is a READ IT NOW book!

Dopo una lunga sfilza di fantasy ho voluto staccare un pò la spina con un bel romance, ne ho preso uno a caso dalla mia libreria virtuale. Cosi mi è capitato questo libro.Dalle stelline, avrete già capito che non mi è piaciuto affatto.Solita storia, lui ricchissimo, prepotente, tutti ai suoi piedi, bellissimo, ecc..Lei ragazzina squattrinata, ingenua e timida.. però devo ammettere ottima artista.Ian sceglie Francesca, per realizzare un quadro per la sua società, ed è proprio il giorno della celebrazione di questa scelta che si conoscono, ovviamente, neanche ben visti che tra loro nasce un attrazione.Non troviamo una vera storia, niente movimento, niente di niente, il libro è incentrato solo ed esclusivamente sulla loro relazione sessuale.Lui è un dominatore, e lei diventa la sua sottomessa. Ormai è strapieno di libri di dominatori e sottomesse, per essere un romanzo erotico, secondo me non c'è bisogno di ripetere sempre le stesse figure. Mi sta bene, se l'uomo nel sesso prenda l'iniziativa e il controllo, può andare bene fare qualche gioco più audace, usare bende e manette, ma arrivare a usare frustini, palette e picchiare una donna, è troppo e secondo me di cattivo gusto. Uso il termine picchiare, perchè l'autrice usa questa parola. Io sono rimasta veramente schifata, perchè in questo libro, la donna viene tratta come se fosse una bambola gonfiabile, lei non può toccare lui, certe volte viene utilizzata solo per il piacere di Ian, e non per il suo, come succede nel viaggio di ritorno da Londra. Ok alla protagonista piacciono tutte queste cosa, ma non giustifica il fatto che sempre secondo me, non ci sia stato il rispetto verso la figura della donna. La prima volta e l'unica volta che lei ha preso l'iniziativa, lui l'ha punita sculacciandola e attaccandola in una specie di altalena, che non saprei neanche come spiegarvi.Magari qualcuno penserà che sono antica o roba del genere, ma non tollero quando sento alla tv che una donna sia stata picchiata, mancata di rispetto ecc.. e non posso giustificare queste cose, anche se fatte a letto e anche se la donna sia consenziente, per me resta sempre mettere le mani addosso. Ma poi mi sono anche chiesta, cavolo Francesca, non hai un minimo di dignità?? lasci fare a Ian tutto quello che gli passa per la testa, non solo in camera da letto, ma anche al di fuori.Mi è piaciuto lo stile di scrittura, solo per quello ho dato due stelline, se no sarebbe stata una.
